subject: Productivity
title: Goals as Attention Filters
description: A short lesson to help you apply Goals as Attention Filters.

hook.text: You buy a red car and suddenly see red cars everywhere. Goals work the same way.

buildup.text: The reticular activating system in your brain filters incoming information by relevance.

discovery.text: When you set a clear goal, your brain starts noticing opportunities and information related to it.

twist.text: It's not luck or the universe conspiring. It's your brain's filter tuning to what you told it matters.

climax.text: Goals literally change what you see. They restructure attention before you lift a finger.

punchline.text: Set a goal and your brain starts scanning for it.

quiz.question: How do goals affect attention according to neuroscience?
options: They activate brain filters that notice relevant opportunities
They reduce the brain's activity level
They have no effect on perception
